Text: Good morning class, today we are going to learn about different types of sentences.
Label: PRS

Text: The first type of sentence we will learn about is the declarative sentence.
Label: NA

Text: A declarative sentence makes a statement or expresses an opinion.
Label: NA

Text: Can anyone give me an example of a declarative sentence?
Label: OTR

Text: That's a perfect example! Declarative sentences end with a period.
Label: NA

Text: Next, we have interrogative sentences. These are sentences that ask a question.
Label: NA

Text: Interrogative sentences end with a question mark.
Label: NA

Text: Can someone give me an example of an interrogative sentence?
Label: OTR

Text: Great job! That is indeed an interrogative sentence.
Label: PRS

Text: Now, let's move on to imperative sentences. These sentences give a command or make a request.
Label: NA

Text: Imperative sentences often end with a period, but they can also end with an exclamation mark if they are urgent.
Label: NA

Text: Can someone give me an example of an imperative sentence?
Label: OTR

Text: Excellent! That sentence is giving a command, so it is an imperative sentence.
Label: NA

Text: Lastly, we have exclamatory sentences. These sentences express strong emotion.
Label: NA

Text: Exclamatory sentences end with an exclamation mark.
Label: NA

Text: Can someone give me an example of an exclamatory sentence?
Label: OTR

Text: Wonderful! That sentence is showing strong emotion, so it is an exclamatory sentence.
Label: PRS

Text: Now, let's write down examples of each type of sentence in our notebooks.
Label: NA

Text: Next, we are going to learn about prepositions.
Label: NA

Text: Prepositions are words that show how nouns and pronouns relate to other words in a sentence.
Label: NA

Text: Can someone give me an example of a preposition?
Label: OTR

Text: Exactly, 'on' is a preposition because it shows the relationship between two words in a sentence.
Label: NA

Text: Let's write down some prepositions in our notebooks.
Label: NA

Text: Now, let's use prepositions to build sentences.
Label: NA

Text: I'll start with a noun: 'The book'.
Label: NA

Text: Can someone add a preposition to our sentence?
Label: OTR

Text: Great, now our sentence is: 'The book on the table'.
Label: PRS

Text: Let's write down some of our own sentences using prepositions in our notebooks.
Label: NA

Text: Well done, everyone! You have learned a lot today.
Label: PRS

Text: Remember to practice using these new sentences in your writing.
Label: NA

Text: For homework, please write a paragraph using different types of sentences and prepositions.
Label: NA

Text: Make sure to use declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences in your paragraph.
Label: NA

Text: Don't forget to use prepositions to show relationships between words.
Label: NA

Text: I am looking forward to reading your paragraphs.
Label: PRS

Text: Have a great day, and remember to keep practicing your English!
Label: NA
